intro: Acicarphaea artemisiifolia, commonly known as common wormwood, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and has been introduced to other regions. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in waste areas. The plant contains volatile oils and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
